sourcesContent: import React from 'react' interface IInputProps { // unique id for the control id?: string // Control type // Default: text type: ControlType // Data is the value given by useField (react-final-form-hooks library) // Example data object for Email would be: { Email.input } { Email.meta } data?: any // Label text (Required) label?: string // Text max length maxLength?: number // Text min length minLength?: number // Native mobile features autoComplete?: string autoCorrect?: string autoCapitalize?: string spellCheck?: boolean // Specifies whether a control is required or not required?: boolean disabled?: boolean autoFocus?: boolean onInput?: any placeholder?: string } // Allowed control types type ControlType = | 'button' | 'checkbox' | 'color' | 'date' | 'datetime-local' | 'email' | 'file' | 'hidden' | 'image' | 'month' | 'number' | 'password' | 'radio' | 'range' | 'reset' | 'search' | 'submit' | 'tel' | 'text' | 'time' | 'url' | 'week' const Input: React.FC = (props) => { const { data, type, label, ...rest } = props const hasErrors = data?.meta?.touched && data?.meta?.error ? true : false return ( <> {hasErrors && {data?.meta?.error}} ) } const defaultProps: IInputProps = { data: null, type: 'text', label: '', autoComplete: 'off', autoCorrect: 'off', autoCapitalize: 'off', spellCheck: false, } Input.defaultProps = defaultProps export default Input
